snippet: In the Soviet era, the health of Kremlin leaders was regarded as a state secret. Now, under the presidency of Vladimir V. Putin, an official has criticized the press for asking too many questions about the Russian leader's sore back.
abstract: In the Soviet era, the health of Kremlin leaders was regarded as a state secret. Now, under the presidency of Vladimir V. Putin, an official has criticized the press for asking too many questions about the Russian leader's sore back.

headline.main: Health Concerns for Russia's Alpha Dog
